unit_learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate the ability to apply accumulated knowledge and skills to make decisions in the context of professional practice and/or scholarship
Acquire a coherent and advanced knowledge of the principles and concepts within the discipline area
Synthesize and analyse information from a variety of sources
Demonstrate an advanced knowledge of research principles and methods
Articulate clearly a coherent argument in written, oral and technical communication skill as relevant to the specific needs of the discipline
Identify and provide solutions to complex problems with intellectual independence
Think critically and make informed and logical judgement on the arguments of others to arrive at reasonable and meaningful arguments and positions, and formulate and apply ideas to new contexts

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Background readings and preparation in consultation with unit convenor

enrolment_rules.description: (Admission to GradDipBiotech or GradCertLabAQMgt or GradDipLabAQMgt or MBiotech or MBioBus or MLabAQMgt or MRadiopharmSc or MSc or MScInnovationChemBiomolecularSc) and permission by special approval

assessments.description:
Assessment tasks and weighting to be determined by supervisor for project/activity based units or as listed in unit guides where components of other units are being undertaken; and approved by Unit Convener. 

Minimum 3 tasks required, with a maximum of 60% weighting for any one task. Tasks can vary, eg scientific report, essay (3000 words), exam. Workload must be appropriate for 10cp unit.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances
Session 1, Special circumstances
data.subject_search_title: MOLS8001 - Selected Topics in the Molecular Sciences
data.description: This unit will focus on special topics in Molecular Science. Topics may include biochemistry, cell biology, molecular biology and genomics, medicinal chemistry, organic chemistry, physical chemistry and analytical chemistry; and focus on processes in molecular sciences. Topics will be chosen to encourage students to explore the different disciplines in the Molecular Sciences and to develop knowledge and skills in analysis and investigation.
